_data.title: Creating an Env Setup Script

children.value:
The other day, I decided to make a setup script for wasteof.money. If you don't know what wasteof.money is, check it out at dev.wasteof.money!
To start, I wanted to write to .env. The script I wrote for that simply wrote to .env using fs.
Then, I wanted to have the user be able to put in inputs. For that, I used the prompts package from NPM. My code now looked like this:
"What is your MongoDB URL? (If you are using MongoDB Atlas, you can keep the <> values)"
"What port should the site run on?"
"Run npm run serve to start the server or npm run dev to start it with nodemon."
At this point, the code was working, but it still didn't satisfy me. I wanted the user to be able to input a password and have that switched out with the
I decided that it should also ask the user if they are using local, or Atlas. My final version looked like this.
"What is your MongoDB URL? (If you are using MongoDB Atlas, you can keep the <> values)"
"What port should the site run on?"
"Run npm run serve to start the server or npm run dev to start it with nodemon."

_data.title: My favorite npm packages

children.value: As you probably know, npm is the package manager for Node.JS. Here are my 5 favorite npm packages.

Chalk lets you print colored data to the console.
For example:
Bijou.js is a package that provides utilities for node and in the browser
Node-fetch is a package that provides
for Node. It's awesome for fetching data in node applications, since the use is identical to

To fetch data, you could use it like this:
Vue is a package that does all of your DOM manipulation for you. It's amazing, and is my tool of choice for any new projects.
Nuxt provides SSR for Vue. It also includes easier components, single file pages, layouts, and more.

_data.title: Welcome to my new Nuxt site!

children.value: Hi, and welcome to my new Nuxt site and blog! It's a lot faster and has a PWA. Currently, it's staticly generated with
in GitHub Actions and deployed to GitHub Pages.

_data.text: Hi, and welcome to my new Nuxt site and blog! It's a lot faster and has a PWA. Currently, it's staticly generated with ``nuxt generate`` in GitHub Actions and deployed to GitHub Pages.
